oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sara Ward Conley in studio
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Sara Ward Conley sitting in her studio, holding a paintbrush and palette. Several paintings and sculptures (primarily bust sculptures) are visible in both rooms.

Sara Ward Conley (1859-1944) was a Nashville artist and architect. She studied art in Paris and Rome and traveled to England before returning to Nashville, where she designed the Women's Building for the Tennessee Centennial Exposition in 1896. She taught art classes from her apartment, where many souvenirs from her travels were displayed.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Giers Art Gallery; Giers, Nicolas, 1853-1924
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Conley, Sara Ward, 1859-1944
